Package Funds.Dialogs

Class AccountDetailsDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.control.Dialog
      • Funds.Dialogs.AccountDetailsDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.event.EventTarget, javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AccountDetailsDialog
extends javafx.scene.control.Dialog
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Dialog to create a new account, the traditional cornerstone of double-entry method accounting practices: some accounts increase with a debit (left column) and decrease with a credit (right column) while other accounts are the reverse and every dollar recorded is listed in both a debit and a column credit somewhere.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AccountDetailsDialog​(Book book, AccountType type)
      The two-arg constructor needs a reference to the current Book and type of account as a string (not the enum value yet) which it gets from context menu on balance sheet tree
      AccountDetailsDialog​(Book book, AccountType type, AccountCategory parent)
      The three-arg constructor needs a reference to the current Book and type of account as a string (not the enum value yet) which it gets from context menu on balance sheet tree, and the subcategory which this account goes into
      AccountDetailsDialog​(Book book, Account account)

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccountDetailsDialog

        public AccountDetailsDialog​(Book book,
                            AccountType type)
        The two-arg constructor needs a reference to the current Book and type of account as a string (not the enum value yet) which it gets from context menu on balance sheet tree
        Parameters:
        book - The current book this account is being added to
        type - String (NOT ENUM VALUE this class will set that) representing the type of account ("Assets", "Liabilities", "Equity")

      • AccountDetailsDialog

        public AccountDetailsDialog​(Book book,
                            AccountType type,
                            AccountCategory parent)
        The three-arg constructor needs a reference to the current Book and type of account as a string (not the enum value yet) which it gets from context menu on balance sheet tree, and the subcategory which this account goes into
        Parameters:
        book - The current book this account is being added to
        type - String (NOT ENUM VALUE this class will set that) representing the type of account ("Assets", "Liabilities", "Equity")
        parent - The subcategory of accounts this new account will go into

      • AccountDetailsDialog

        public AccountDetailsDialog​(Book book,
                            Account account)
